bill_title: to provide a penalty for strikes by public employees.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a penalty for strikes by public employees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 3-18-10 be amended to read as follows: 3-18-10. No public employee shall may strike against the State of South Dakota, any of the political subdivisions thereof of the state , any of its authorities, commissions, or boards, the public school system , or any other branch of the public service. Provided, however, that However, nothing contained in this chapter shall be construed to limit, impair or affect, limits, impairs, or affects the right of any public employee to the expression or communication of a view, grievance, complaint , or opinion on any matter related to the conditions or compensation of public employment or their betterment with the full, faithful , and proper performance of the duties of employment. Any person who violates this section is subject to a civil penalty of one thousand dollars for each day of violation. Any resident of the affected district or county in which the strike occurred may enforce this section. All moneys recovered shall be paid to the affected governmental entity to offset the cost and expenses of the strike. However, any person bringing the action may recover all costs, expenses, and attorneys fees expended to enforce this section. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a penalty for strikes by public employees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 3-18-10 be amended to read as follows: 3-18-10. No public employee shall may strike against the State of South Dakota, any of the political subdivisions thereof of the state , any of its authorities, commissions, or boards, the public school system , or any other branch of the public service. Provided, however, that However, nothing contained in this chapter shall be construed to limit, impair or affect, limits, impairs, or affects the right of any public employee to the expression or communication of a view, grievance, complaint , or opinion on any matter related to the conditions or compensation of public employment or their betterment with the full, faithful , and proper performance of the duties of employment. Any person who violates this section is subject to a civil penalty of up to one thousand dollars for each day of violation. Any resident of the affected district or county in which the strike occurred may enforce this section. All moneys recovered shall be paid to the affected governmental entity. However, any person bringing the action may recover all costs, expenses, and attorneys fees expended to enforce this section. BILL HISTORY 1/31/97 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 241 2/10/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/10/97 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, AYES 9, NAYS 4. H.J. 399

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a penalty for strikes by public employees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 3-18-10 be amended to read as follows: 3-18-10. No public employee shall may strike against the State of South Dakota, any of the political subdivisions thereof of the state , any of its authorities, commissions, or boards, the public school system , or any other branch of the public service. Provided, however, that However, nothing contained in this chapter shall be construed to limit, impair or affect, limits, impairs, or affects the right of any public employee to the expression or communication of a view, grievance, complaint , or opinion on any matter related to the conditions or compensation of public employment or their betterment with the full, faithful , and proper performance of the duties of employment. Any person who violates this section is subject to a civil penalty of up to one thousand dollars for each day of violation. The governing boards of the state and its political subdivisions may seek enforcement of civil penalties in circuit court. All moneys recovered shall be paid to the affected governmental entity. However, any person bringing the action may recover all costs, expenses, and attorneys fees expended to enforce this section. BILL HISTORY 1/31/97 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 241 2/10/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/10/97 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, AYES 9, NAYS 4. 2/12/97 Motion to Amend. H.J. 452 2/12/97 Motion to Amend. H.J. 453 2/12/97 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, AYES 55, NAYS 10. H.J. 453
